<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Setting precision=16 when training with a TPU throws an error <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
see colab: <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1s-ZDIqzgKQ1Byf-Lw58RZ8LGgmdB6qjB>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1s-ZDIqzgKQ1Byf-Lw58RZ8LGgmdB6qjB</denchmark-link>
Relavent stack trace: <denchmark-code>Exception in device=TPU:0: str expected, not int Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch_xla/distributed/xla_multiprocessing.py", line 119, in _start_fn fn(gindex, *args) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_parts.py", line 492, in tpu_train os.environ['XLA_USE_BF16'] = 1 File "/usr/lib/python3.6/os.py", line 674, in __setitem__ value = self.encodevalue(value) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/os.py", line 744, in encode raise TypeError("str expected, not %s" % type(value).__name__) TypeError: str expected, not int </denchmark-code>
To fix this all that should be needed should be casting 1 to a string <denchmark-code> os.environ['XLA_USE_BF16'] = str(1) </denchmark-code>
